channel.title: Comments for page "Science! Facility"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Science! Facility"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Well, that or shovelclocking (my term for when shovel gives LO items).

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Greassy Royale really rocks with such a low appetite needed :) LO effect gives a low chance to find it, no chances without LO.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: actually, i wanted the sammich… thing. the item to make greassy royale. waaaay after i no longer needed it, ironically

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: @Palmatzu: If LO from SCIENCE machine is active ALL searches for ALL villagers at THIS day give mixed and rare items. I did this several times some seasons ago(spent arena points and stam for bonus searches). BUT!!! If u wanna candyween items(perms), u'll have only a CHANCE with LO effect, without it u'll have NO even a chance :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Probably because LO only adds the chance of rare finds

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: that hasnt been holding for all of my non-first searches…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: No, you're quite wrong. LO applies to ALL searches.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Im pretty sure Lunar Overclocking (LO henceforth) works on FIRST use. In other words, attempting to search again will not use LO, because you already used it once.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Seperate checks for each.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: in reference to Lunar Overclocking, we can use the Shovel (from Z-Rewards) and/or Pinchy Claw (from Party House) to also get lunar overclocking results. My question: do these two stack? like, do the checks for shovel and claw stack, or do they run separate checks?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
In the old system, basically, once a Kaiju was reduced to 1 HP, the Kage had to deal the final blow. It would then be immediately defeated, and give out the drops. You could them summon a new one.

Get most of the village working together and minor Kaiju go down easily. Get enough people, and you can win on just the 'free' swings from a Kaiju-bashing team like Strawberry Sundae or Strawberry Pizza.

In the end, the only limit was Village Resources, time, and Stamina.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: If you read the middle, "before Enticement was limited to once per day" you can guess. I wasn't playing that far back, but from others, I understand that some time ago you didn't need to wait for dayroll for the kaiju to fall (I think kage had the option for final strike) and could summon a kaiju right away. If I understood correctly, kaijus didn't have as much HP as they do now, so these villages managed to smite many kaijus quickly.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
"The effects of the Kaijuchainer 11000 reference two villages, The Epic and ScarletP, which, before Enticement was limited to once per day, managed to summon and defeat over 100 Kaiju in a single day"
What does this mean? 100 in one day at one village? HOW???

item.title: Science 6 Machine 2nd Effect
item.content:encoded:
Spontaneous Eating Contest -> Eating Ramen gives +20 Appetite

The base cost without Unparalleled Intelligence would be 7,000,000.

item.title: SCI 6 Machine
item.content:encoded:
Name: Pan-Universal Jumpulator
Description: Adds zaniness to the local surroundings
Cost to Tinker/Unleash: 5950000 Ryo (Lv.3 Awesome)

First Effect: Sakura Petalstorm -> +4 Juice Limit
Second Effect: ??? -> It's a secret to everyone!
Third Effect: ??? -> It's a secret to everyone!

Working on unlocking others. will fill stuff in as i get it… (need more village ryo though as we only have like 20-some people active and 3-4 bring in over 80% the income)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: New machine for upcoming Halloween stuffs. Anyone out there with science privileges got any info?

item.title: More machines
item.content:encoded: The answer above is inaccurate; I altered the main article according to a Q&A I got answered.

item.title: More machines
item.content:encoded: You get the next machine by tinkering the current highest one to Maximum, I believe.
